findings.title: M01. Copy of Well-Known Contracts
findings.description: The contract contains copies of OZ contracts that can instead be imported.

findings.title: L01. Style Guide Violation - Naming Conventions
findings.description: The provided projects should follow the official guidelines according to the Solidity Naming Conventions Guidelines, constants should be named with all capital letters with underscores separating words.

findings.title: L02. Outdated Solidity Version
findings.description: Using an outdated compiler version can be problematic, especially if publicly disclosed bugs and issues affect the current compiler version.

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the Customer.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract. There should not be any cases when execution fails due to the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation
findings.description: The code should not reference draft contracts, which may be changed in the future.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: Ensuring smart contract meets specified requirements and regulations.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: The code should not reference draft contracts, which may be changed in the future.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: Provide tests to increase test coverage.

findings.title: M01. Copy of Well-Known Contracts
findings.description: The contract contains copies of OZ contracts that can instead be imported.

findings.title: L01. Style Guide Violation - Naming Conventions
findings.description: The provided projects should follow the official guidelines according to the Solidity Naming Conventions Guidelines, constants should be named with all capital letters with underscores separating words.

findings.title: L02. Outdated Solidity Version
findings.description: Using an outdated compiler version can be problematic, especially if publicly disclosed bugs and issues affect the current compiler version.

findings.title: L03. SPDX License Identifier not Provided in a Source File
findings.description: Before publishing, consider adding a comment containing "SPDX-License-Identifier: <SPDX-License>" to each source file.

findings.title: L04. No Messages in Require Conditions
findings.description: The require condition can be used to check for conditions and throw an exception if the condition is not met. It is possible to provide a message string for require. If a string argument to require is not provided, it will revert with empty error data, not even including the error selector.
